prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: A lawyer who's been at the agency since before I joined. He has an amazing ability to spot lies through people's tells.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The lawyer who owns the agency. I owe him for giving me the chance to become a full-fledged lawyer.
Character 2
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: Mr. Wright's darling daughter. She wants to be a famous magician someday.
Character 3
Name: Aristotle Means
Description: A lawyer course professor at the academy. His smile is somewhat scary.
Character 4
Name: Constance Courte
Description: The professor who invited Mr. Wright to the academy. She is a judge course teacher, but she's not very punctual.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: A senior in the judge course. She's a good friend, and I've known her since childhood.
Character 6
Name: Hugh O'Conner
Description: A senior in the lawyer course who served as the defense in the mock trial. He seems like kind of a jerk.
Character 7
Name: Robin Newman
Description: A senior in the prosecutor course who served as the prosecution in the mock trial. He tends to shout at people.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The lively detective in charge of this case. He makes you wonder what justice is really all about.
Character 9
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He has mastered the use of psychological manipulation in courtroom battles.
Character 10
Name: Klavier Gavin
Description: Mr. Rock Star Prosecutor himself, he was the leader and vocalist of the Gavinners.
Character 11
Name: Myriam Scuttlebutt
Description: A senior in the judge course. She is the aloof editor-in-chief of the school paper who walks around with a box over her head.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My brand-new, shiny badge. It shows that I'm a lawyer.
Evidence 1
Name: Arrow
Description: The arrow that pierced the victim's side. It's stained with blood.
Evidence 2
Name: Courte's Planner
Description: Constance Courte's planner. A sword emblem is printed on the cover and on each page. [info] She recorded all of her plans in great detail. One page reads, "23rd - Meet with Hugh" and "Important."
Evidence 3
Name: Themis Herald
Description: A school paper with a malicious scoop on an alleged love triangle involving Junie.
Evidence 4
Name: Stage Costume
Description: A costume Junie was supposed to wear. It has a glowing star pattern. (With notes, 2 pages.)
Evidence 5
Name: Mock Trial Script
Description: A top secret script written by Junie. There's only one copy. (4 pages.)
Evidence 6
Name: Themis Herald Extra
Description: An extra edition of the school paper that covers the mock trial.
Evidence 7
Name: Awl
Description: The weapon used to murder Constance Courte. Her blood was found on it along with Junie's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Courte's Autopsy Report
Description: Est. time of death: Between 6 and 8 PM. Cause of death: Blood loss from a deep stab wound in the victim's side.
Evidence 9
Name: Tape Recorder
Description: Used by Myriam to secretly record the conversation in the art room. A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" A woman can be heard shouting, "You're a goner!" Recorded in the art room at 7:10 PM on the 23rd. The voice on the tape says "You're a goner!" just like in Junie's script. It may be a fake. The voice on the tape says "You're a goner!" just like in Junie's script. It's been identified as a fake. Identified as a fake. Prof. Means used Hugh to pass it on to the police.
Evidence 10
Name: Glowing Costume Photo
Description: A photo of the stage costume taken in a dark room. A coat of fluorescent paint made it glow.
Evidence 11
Name: School Camera Photo
Description: A photo of the art room while preparations were being made. Taken on the day of the murder.
Evidence 12
Name: School Banner
Description: A large banner that was hung by a wire between the stage and art room. A trace amount of blood was found on it.
Evidence 13
Name: Purple Fragment → Purple Fragments
Description: A purple fragment from a broken statue. It was found all alone in the strangest of places. Two purple fragments of a broken statue. Going to search for more. Three purple fragments of a broken statue that originally stood on a pedestal onstage.
Evidence 14
Name: White Fragment → White Fragments
Description: A large, white fragment. It has a distinctive shape that could be described as angular. Two large, white fragments. It looks like it would feel good to break them.
Evidence 15
Name: Lady Justice
Description: This and the statue of Klavier were broken at the same time, but have been repaired. No one knows where it came from. It was found broken onstage. Professor Courte had remade it into a completely different-looking statue the day before the mock trial.
Evidence 16
Name: "Hugh" Scrap
Description: Discovered onstage, it appears to be a piece of paper torn from a notebook. The name "Hugh" is written on it.
Evidence 17
Name: Burnt Fragments
Description: The burnt remnants of the Gavinners banner that was tossed into the incinerator and later found by Myriam.
Evidence 18
Name: Stage Set Up Photos
Description: The last two of Myriam's photos. They show the students setting up the stage's backdrop on the night of the murder. (2 photos.)
Evidence 19
Name: Voiceprint Analysis
Description: The results of the voice analysis performed on the tape recording.
Evidence 20
Name: Lecture Hall Diagram
Description: A diagram of the lecture hall where the mock trial took place.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I snuck into Juniper's dressing room while everyone was in the Lecture Hall.
Person: Scuttlebutt
Testimony 1
Testimony: Juniper had changed into her stage costume. I asked her, "What're you doing?"
Person: Scuttlebutt
Testimony 2
Testimony: When suddenly, she fled into the hallway, as if she wanted me to follow her.
Person: Scuttlebutt
Testimony 3
Testimony: I followed her all the way to Prof. Courte's body! She led me right to it!
Person: Scuttlebutt
Testimony 4
Testimony: I'm positive it was Juniper because she was wearing the costume that she had made! [caption] The photo shows the back of a figure in a plain blue costume.
Person: Scuttlebutt

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I'm a bit new to this, but I'll take it step by step.

First, I need to go through each testimony and evidence to see if any of them directly oppose each other. Let's start with the testimonies.

Testimony 0 says that Scuttlebutt sneaked into Juniper's dressing room while everyone was in the Lecture Hall. Testimony 1 mentions that Juniper had changed into her stage costume when Scuttlebutt asked her what she was doing. Testimony 2 says she fled into the hallway, making Scuttlebutt follow her. Testimony 3 claims she led Scuttlebutt to Prof. Courte's body, and Testimony 4 states that it was definitely Juniper because she was wearing the costume she made, with a photo showing the back of a figure in a plain blue costume.

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 7 is the Awl, which has Junie's fingerprints and Courte's blood. Evidence 2 is Courte's Planner with a note about meeting Hugh on the 23rd, marked as important. Evidence 4 is the Mock Trial Script, a top secret with only one copy. Evidence 6 is the Themis Herald Extra covering the mock trial. Evidence 10 is the Glowing Costume Photo, showing the stage costume with a glowing effect. Evidence 11 is the School Camera Photo of the art room setup. Evidence 12 is the School Banner with blood traces. Evidence 13 is Purple Fragments found in strange places, and Evidence 15 is Lady Justice, a broken statue repaired by Courte.

Now, thinking about Testimony 4, Scuttlebutt says she saw Juniper wearing a plain blue costume, which matches the Glowing Costume Photo (Evidence 10). However, Evidence 10 describes the costume as having a glowing star pattern, which isn't mentioned in Testimony 4. The photo also shows it's a stage costume, which aligns with Testimony 1 and 4.

Wait, but Testimony 4 mentions the photo shows the back of a figure in a plain blue costume. The Glowing Costume Photo (Evidence 10) shows a glowing star pattern, which is different from plain blue. So Testimony 4 says the costume is plain blue, but the evidence shows it's glowing with stars. That's a contradiction because the testimony describes the costume differently than the evidence.

Another point: Testimony 3 says she led Scuttlebutt to Courte's body, but Evidence 8's Autopsy Report says Courte died between 6-8 PM. If the mock trial was on the 23rd, and the evidence mentions the tape was recorded at 7:10 PM, which would fit within that timeframe. So Scuttlebutt's testimony about leading her to the body might not directly contradict evidence, but the costume description does.

So, the main contradiction is between Testimony 4 and Evidence 10 regarding the costume's appearance. Testimony 4 says plain blue, while Evidence 10 shows a glowing star pattern. Therefore, the evidence contradicts the testimony.
</think>

Person: O'Conner
Testimony 1

Person: O'Conner
Testimony 2
Testimony: We didn't say much as we passed by each other. She seemed her usual self.
Person: O'Conner
Testimony 3
Testimony: Oh, let me add I never went to the art room. There was no reason for me to be there.
Person: O'Conner
Testimony 4
Testimony: The final bell had rung ten, fifteen minutes earlier. No biggie.
Person: O'Conner
Testimony 5

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through the testimonies and the evidence to see where there's a conflict.

First, looking at the testimonies from Hugh O'Conner, Testimony 3 says he didn't go to the art room because there was no reason to be there. But Testimony 1 mentions that he saw Juniper at around 7:15 PM, which is after the time the art room recording was made at 7:10 PM. So if he didn't go to the art room, how did he see Juniper? Maybe the timing is an issue here.

Now, looking at the evidence, Evidence 9 is the tape recorder that Myriam used. The recording was made at 7:10 PM, and the voice says "You're a goner!" which matches Junie's script. But it's been identified as a fake. So the tape is a fake, but the timing matches when Junie was in the art room.

Wait, but Testimony 3 says Hugh didn't go to the art room, which would mean he didn't see Juniper there. However, Testimony 1 says he did see her around 7:15 PM. That's a contradiction because if he didn't go to the art room, he wouldn't have seen her there.

So the key points are:
- Evidence 9 (tape) is a fake, but the timing matches when Junie was in the art room.
- Testimony 3 says Hugh didn't go to the art room, but Testimony 1 says he did see Juniper at 7:15 PM, which is after the tape was recorded.

This means that Hugh's statement that he didn't go to the art room contradicts the evidence that he was there around the time of the recording. Therefore, Evidence 9 and Testimony 3 are the conflicting pair.
</think>
